decoworld.server.gambling

Class PokerManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • decoworld.server.gambling.PokerManager

  • public class PokerManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The Manager for the poker games. Manages the instances of the games, but not each game's functionality. Game refers to an instance of a Poker game. TODO remove game

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PokerManager()
      Constructs the manager with no games and an empty list of games

      • getGames

      • createGame

        public boolean createGame(int gameId)
        Attempts to create a game. Creates the game with the specified gameID and returns true. If game already exists, does nothing and returns false. TODO maybe remove the specified gameID and just go off internal ID numbering system
        Parameters:
        gameId - the ID of the game that is being created
        Returns:
        true if the game was successfully created false otherwise

      • connectToGame

        public boolean connectToGame(int gameId,
                    java.lang.String player,
                    com.esotericsoftware.kryonet.Connection c)
        Attempts to connect the user to the game. If the game exists, try to connect. And if that connects successfully return true.
        Parameters:
        gameId - The ID of the game that is being connected to
        player - the ID of the player that is connecting
        c - the connection on which the player is connecting
        Returns:
        true if successfully connected false otherwise

      • gameExists

        public PokerGameHandler gameExists(int gameId)
        Checks whether a game exists with the specified gameID
        Parameters:
        gameId - the ID of the game being checked
        Returns:
        returns the game handler for the game if it exists null if it does not

      • recieveMessage

        public void recieveMessage(decoworld.protocol.connect.gambling.PokerGameRequest request,
                  com.esotericsoftware.kryonet.Connection c)
        Handler for receiving PokerGameRequests. Handles actions "connect" and "create". Sends back the game ID of the game if successfully connected to, or created. If the action wasn't executed successfully, sends back 0
        Parameters:
        request - the request that has been received
        c - the connection that the request has been sent from

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(int gameId,
               com.esotericsoftware.kryonet.Connection c)
        Sends the message back to the client regarding the gameID
        Parameters:
        gameId - the gameID being sent
        c - the connection that the ID is being sent to
